title: Lobed Pear-Shaped Bottle with Floral Escutcheons
medium: Ceramic; fritware, painted in cobalt blue and red (copper) and yellow (silver) luster on an opaque white glaze
markings:
This bottle bears the no. S.L. 1852.3. There is also a sticker of the International Exhibition of Persian Art, 1931, with the number U.S.394. 
Inside the neck of the bottle is a sticker reading: Feb 1911 
I give this bottle to Horace as a wedding present .L.W Havemeyer 1E66.
credit_line: Gift of Mrs. Horace O. Havemeyer

museum_location.name: This item is not on view
